intro: Morilloa furlanii, commonly known as the Furlanii's morilloa, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and diverse ecological adaptations. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, showcasing resilience to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Morilloa furlanii plays a vital role in its ecosystem, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
